text: The 100 yards event at the 1922 Women's World Games took place in Paris at the Stade Pershing on 20 August 1922. Eight athletes from four nations participated in the 100 yards. Both the heats and the final took place during during the afternoon session. During the event two world records were broken. Marie Mejzlikova II broke during heat 2 the world record in the 100 yards with 11.4 seconds, and also in the 80 metres with 10.0 seconds. British Nora Callebout won the final in a time of 12.0 seconds, ahead of the Czechoslovak Marie Mejzlikova II and British Mary Lines. ==Results== ===Heats=== The heats consisted of two series, where best two athletes of each heat continued to the final. ====Heat 1==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Mary Lines 11.6 sec Q 2 12.2 sec Q 3 Bozena Srámková 4 Ester Green ====Heat 2==== Rank Name Nationality Time Notes 1 Marie Mejzlikova II 11.4 sec WR, Q 2 Nora Callebout Q 3 Mabel Gilliland 4 During the second heat, Marie Mejzlikova II also broke the 80 metres world record.
